Charles Ehrlich wrote:
> Another sign that Radiance continues to be popular is that the sales of Rendering with Radiance have gone up dramatically (4x) this past month.  Perhaps this is because the book is now available at Amazon.com with quick-ship.  It says there are 5 books in stock that can be delivered by Nov. 12th.  


Probably the 4 other people (plus me) which are using the Debian package
of radiance according to popcon:


http://people.debian.org/~igloo/popcon-graphs/index.php?packages=radiance&show_installed=on&show_vote=on&show_old=on&show_recent=on&show_nofiles=on&want_legend=on&want_ticks=on&from_date=2007-09-01&to_date=2007-11-08&hlght_date=&date_fmt=%25Y-%25m&beenhere=1


Also are 40 installations not a bad rate for a new package which was not
really advertised except with a one-liner in my blog. I still need to
prepare a longer article about Radiance, planet.debian.org is read by a
few people...


> Oh darn...that wasn't supposed to sound like an advertisement.  :-)
